description: A 2.75" 12 gauge shotgun shell loaded with 1 1/8 oz of #7.5 lead shot.  Designed for hunting birds and other small game, its applications in combat are very limited.  This one has been handloaded by a survivor or perhaps a pre-Cataclysm hobbyist, leading to slightly inferior performance compared to factory-produced ammo.

A 2.75" 12 gauge shotgun shell loaded with magnesium pellets or shards, used mostly as a pyrotechnics novelty.  When the round is fired, high-temperature sparks and flames shoot out of the barrel, igniting everything in their path.  This one was made in somebody's garage.  Are you sure you want to shoot this?

A 2.75" 12 gauge shotgun shell loaded with 9 #00 lead pellets.  Extremely damaging, plus the spread makes it very accurate at short range.  SWAT forces wouldn't use this homebrew shell, but a sovereign citizen looking to fend off SWAT probably would.

A 2.75" shotgun shell loaded with twenty-five 18.5mm long darts, weighing 0.47 grams each.  Extremely damaging, plus the spread makes it very accurate at short range.  Slices through most forms of armor with ease.  This one has been handloaded by a survivor or perhaps a pre-Cataclysm hobbyist, leading to slightly inferior performance compared to factory-produced ammo.

A heavy metal slug used to give a shotgun the range capabilities of a rifle.  Extremely damaging but rather inaccurate.  This one has been handloaded by a survivor or perhaps a pre-Cataclysm hobbyist, leading to slightly inferior performance compared to factory-produced ammo.

A 2.75" 12 gauge shotgun shell loaded with 1 1/8 oz of #7.5 lead shot.  Designed for hunting birds and other small game, its applications in combat are very limited.  Someone was down on their luck when they handloaded this one - it's loaded with black powder instead of smokeless powder.  Expect lower velocity, muzzle smoke, and a dirtier barrel if you shoot it.

A 2.75" 12 gauge shotgun shell loaded with magnesium pellets or shards, used mostly as a pyrotechnics novelty.  When the round is fired, high-temperature sparks and flames shoot out of the barrel, igniting everything in their path.  This one was made in somebody's garage, and with black gunpowder to boot.  Are you sure you want to shoot this?

A 2.75" 12 gauge shotgun shell loaded with 9 #00 lead pellets.  Extremely damaging, plus the spread makes it very accurate at short range.  SWAT forces probably wouldn't use this one - it's loaded with black powder instead of smokeless powder.  Expect lower velocity, muzzle smoke, and a dirtier barrel if you shoot it.

A 2.75" shotgun shell loaded with twenty-five 18.5mm long darts, weighing 0.47 grams each.  Extremely damaging, plus the spread makes it very accurate at short range.  Slices through most forms of armor with ease.  Someone was down on their luck when they handloaded this one - it's loaded with black powder instead of smokeless powder.  Expect lower velocity, muzzle smoke, and a dirtier barrel if you shoot it.

A 2.75" 12 gauge shotgun shell loaded with a 1oz lead slug used to give a shotgun the range capabilities of a rifle.  Extremely damaging but rather inaccurate.  Someone was down on their luck when they handloaded this one - it's loaded with black powder instead of smokeless powder.  Expect lower velocity, muzzle smoke, and a dirtier barrel if you shoot it.
A 2.75" 12 gauge shotgun shell loaded with 9 #00 lead pellets.  Extremely damaging, plus the spread makes easier to land shots.  Favored by SWAT forces.
A 2.75" 12 gauge shotgun shell loaded with a 1.4oz beanbag round.  Designated 'less-lethal' and intended to disable, but remember that 'less-lethal' does not mean 'non-lethal'.
A 2.75" 12 gauge shotgun shell loaded with 1 1/8 oz of #7.5 lead shot.  Designed for hunting birds and other small game, its applications in combat are very limited.

A 2.75" 12 gauge shotgun shell loaded with magnesium pellets or shards, used mostly as a distress flare or pyrotechnics tool.  When the round is fired, high-temperature sparks and flames shoot out of the barrel, igniting everything in their path.

A 2.75" shotgun shell loaded with twenty-five 18.5mm long darts, weighing 0.47 grams each.  Extremely damaging, but the spread is even greater than that of normal shot.  Slices through most forms of armor with ease.

//: $30/shot thanks to tight regulation, one way or another.
description: A 3" 12ga shotgun shell loaded with a FRAG-12 explosive munition.  While an explosive from a shotgun sounds impressive, its practical applications are limited at best.  The loss in mass in order to accommodate an explosive give it much less impact force compared to traditional ammunition.  The relatively small size of the slug can only accommodate a limited amount of explosives, resulting in a fairly underwelming explosion.  These traits make it a utility tool for damaging barriers and disrupting other explosive devices, rather than something for anti-personnel use.
A shotgun shell loaded with whatever scrap metal was lying around.  More damaging than birdshot, but fairly inaccurate.

A shotgun shell loaded with black gunpowder and whatever scrap metal was lying around.  The logical conclusion of ammunition bootlegging.  It'll kill zombies just fine, but your gun will suffer for it.
A heavy metal slug used to give a shotgun the range capabilities of a rifle.  Extremely damaging but rather inaccurate.
